--- Joseph Reisinger <joeraii@...> wrote:
> I'm not sure if I've mentioned this yet, but one of
> the things I'd like to
> see is a system that evolves the nn developmental
> system rules along with
> the actual entities. Sort of like an coevolutionary
> embodiment thing. The
> way I see it, it could be set up as a simple kind of
> coevolution: one
> population of entities (DNA strings) and a
> population of developmental
> rule sets. 

Why would they need to be logically decoupled?  The
DNA string could could contain instructions for
building particular structures, and developmental rule
sets, right?

> This is along the lines of some of
> DeJong's and also Ficici's
> work over at Brandeis (coevolving teacher/learner
> pairs).

Not familiar with this work, but I'll head on over to
CiteSeer and have a look. 

> This dichotomy is really important in biology, i.e.,
> DNA is almost
> completely useless information without the
> developmental system that it is
> paired with. And the two definately evolved
> together.

But the DNA encodes for the developmental system in
resides in, doesn't it?  I guess I don't see a clear
dichotomy...maybe you could elaborate.
 
> Personally, I'd love to do a PhD thesis on this idea
> if I can get into a
> good graduate school.

You're a senior at UT now?  Where are you thinking of
applying to grad school?

Derek
